abstract.p: Ric Anello is retiring as executive vice president and executive creative director for North America at D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles (S)

block.p: Ric Anello, executive vice president and executive creative director for North America at D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles, based in St. Louis, part of the B Com3 Group, is retiring, effective Oct. 1.

Mr. Anello, 52, who has worked in advertising for 28 years, joined the St. Louis office of D'Arcy in 1990 as vice president and creative director for the Budweiser account. He rose to executive creative director for the St. Louis office in 1997, and in 1998 was named to his current post, working on special projects, particularly in the Los Angeles and Troy, Mich., offices.
Ric Anello, executive vice president and executive creative director for North America at D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles, based in St. Louis, part of the B Com3 Group, is retiring, effective Oct. 1.

Mr. Anello, 52, who has worked in advertising for 28 years, joined the St. Louis office of D'Arcy in 1990 as vice president and creative director for the Budweiser account. He rose to executive creative director for the St. Louis office in 1997, and in 1998 was named to his current post, working on special projects, particularly in the Los Angeles and Troy, Mich., offices.
''I'm leaving the advertising agency business happy and appreciative,'' Mr. Anello said, ''with no plans to return.'' He said he would pursue his interests in writing and filmmaking.
